# precision(_:)

**Instance Method**

Modifies the format style to use the specified precision.

## Declaration

```swift
func precision(_ p: IntegerFormatStyle<Value>.Currency.Configuration.Precision) -> IntegerFormatStyle<Value>.Currency
```

## Parameters

- **p**: The precision to apply to the format style.

## Return Value

An integer currency format style modified to use the specified precision.

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NumberFormatStyleConfiguration/Precision] type lets you specify a fixed number of digits to show for a number’s integer and fractional part, although [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/IntegerFormatStyle/Currency] only uses the former. You can also set a fixed number of significant digits.

## Customizing style behavior

- **decimalSeparator(strategy:)**: Modifies the format style to use the specified decimal separator display strategy.
- **grouping(_:)**: Modifies the format style to use the specified grouping.
- **presentation(_:)**: Modifies the format style to use the specified presentation.
- **rounded(rule:increment:)**: Modifies the format style to use the specified rounding rule and increment.
- **scale(_:)**: Modifies the format style to use the specified scale.
- **sign(strategy:)**: Modifies the format style to use the specified sign display strategy.
- **IntegerFormatStyle.Currency.Configuration**: The type the format style uses for configuration settings.
- **CurrencyFormatStyleConfiguration**: Configuration settings for formatting currency values.
